definition: to release/to let go/to loosen/to untie/to come loose
loose/to loosen/to relax/floss (dry, fluffy food product made from shredded, seasoned meat or fish, used as a topping or filling)

to open/to start/to turn on/to boil/to write out (a prescription, check, invoice etc)/to operate (a vehicle)/carat (gold)/abbr. for Kelvin, 開爾文|开尔文[Kai1 er3 wen2]/abbr. for 開本|开本[kai1 ben3], book format

sentences.english: Their DNA was also loosening up and making memory genes more active.
sentences.chinese: 它们的DNA也松开了，使记忆体基因更加活跃。

sentences.english: Hold the mouth of a balloon filled with air. Let it go suddenly.
sentences.chinese: 捏紧一个充气的汽球口，然后突然松开手。

sentences.english: I wish U'd unclench Ur fists.
sentences.chinese: 我多么希望你能松开你的双拳。

sentences.english: Loosen 1st to open a hand, my wrist was quickly made by you to break.
sentences.chinese: 先松开手，我手腕快被你弄断了。

sentences.english: They spent a lot of time and tried to release him.
sentences.chinese: 他们花了很长时间想帮他把脚松开。

sentences.english: While walking the dog, you were careless and it got loose.
sentences.chinese: 在遛狗的时候，你一粗心松开了手中的狗链。

sentences.english: Loosen the setscrew that secures the ring with the time meridian indicator.
sentences.chinese: 松开固定时间子午线指示环的定位螺丝。

sentences.english: This peg must prevent the winch from unwinding .
sentences.chinese: 这木桩一定是用来防止绞盘松开的。

sentences.english: Loosen but do not remove the subbase screws so that the subbase can move freely.
sentences.chinese: 松开但不要取出座垫固定螺丝，座垫活动了即可。

sentences.english: His hands continued to clench and unclench.
sentences.chinese: 他的双手反复地攥紧又松开。

sentences.english: At once all the prison doors flew open, and everybody's chains came loose.
sentences.chinese: 监门立刻全开，众囚犯的锁链也都松开了。

sentences.english: The brakes let go and the car crashed through the bushes at the edge of the town common, gathering speed.
sentences.chinese: 刹车松开了，汽车碾过了镇边缓冲速度的绿化栏。

sentences.english: I unclenched my hands and looked at my fingers, white and bent.
sentences.chinese: 我靠在椅背上，松开双手，看到手指煞白且无法伸直。

sentences.english: Commodore, he's disabled the rudder chain, sir.
sentences.chinese: 准将，他把舵链松开了，先生。

sentences.english: I let go of her hand and she reached out to touch a pair of shiny black shoes with a strap and silver buckle.
sentences.chinese: 我松开她的手，她伸手去够一双银搭扣的光面黑鞋。

sentences.english: Whether or not that hand becomes less clenched is really up to them.
sentences.chinese: 那只紧紧握拳的手是否会松开一些，无疑要看他们。

definition: to relinquish one's grip/to let go
to detain/to hold back by force/to buckle/to hook
to hold firmly, not let go
to reach out with one's hand/to hold out a hand/(fig.) to beg/to get involved/to meddle
